children.name: the natural ability to do sth well
gift
children.definition: a natural ability to do something very well, which you were born with: năng khiếu
examples: Winterson has great gifts as a writer.

children.name: gift for
examples: He has a giftforlanguages.
You can see that he has a gift for the game.
He was a kind man, with a gift for forming lasting friendships.

children.name: gift of
examples: She has therare giftof being able to laugh at herself.

children.name: ability
children.definition: the ability to do sth well,eitherbecause you have learned how to do it or because you are naturally good at it: khả năng, tài năng
examples: The test measures your mathematical ability.
mixed ability classes
ability to do sth
No one doubts his ability to get work done quickly.
of high/low etc ability
students of average ability
There are musicians of all abilities.
sb’s abilities as a teacher/doctor etc
Harmon decided to create a business out of his abilities as a speaker.
He showed his abilities as a leader.
remarkable/outstanding/exceptional abilitya writer of remarkable ability|The company aims to select people of outstanding ability.|his exceptional ability as a swimmer
spelling/ reading/ writing etc abilitythe level of ability in spelling, reading etc
The children are divided into groups according to their reading ability.
show/demonstrate the ability to do somethinga chance for candidates to demonstrate their abilities

children.name: high/low/average abilitya group of low ability pupils|
examples: Many of these students are of above average ability.|Children of high ability demand more absorbing tasks.

children.name: great/considerable ability
examples: He was a young man of great ability.|These drawings required considerable ability on the part of the artist.

children.name: mixed ability
children.definition: at different levels
examples: a mixed ability class

children.name: uncanny ability
children.definition: an unusual ability that is difficult to explain
examples: He has an uncanny ability for spotting investment opportunities.

children.name: natural ability
children.definition: alsoinnate abilityformal
examples: (= an ability that you are born with )He didn't have the natural ability of his brother.|Babies have an innate ability to do simple maths.

children.name: physical/athletic ability
examples: He has considerable athletic ability.

children.name: artistic/creative ability
examples: You do not need to have any artistic ability.

children.name: musical ability
examples: Tim showed musical ability at an early age.

children.name: acting ability
examples: Her acting abilities were obvious straightaway.

children.name: mental ability
examples: The exercises are supposed to help you improve your mental ability.

children.name: intellectual/academic ability
examples: No one doubts his intellectual abilities.|A degree is evidence of your academic ability in a particular subject area.

children.name: verbal/linguistic ability
children.definition: language skills
examples: The test is intended to measure the children's linguistic ability.

children.name: mathematical ability
examples: These students have a higher level of mathematical ability.

children.name: proven ability
children.definition: that you have proved through your achievements
examples: Companies often value the proven ability and reliability of older employees.

children.name: have the ability to do something
children.definition: alsopossess the ability to do somethingformal
examples: She has the ability to make people feel relaxed.

children.name: lack the ability to do something
examples: As a young man, he lacked the ability to say no.

children.name: a level of ability/ability level
examples: The children were of the same age and ability level.

children.name: a range of ability/ability range
examples: There is a wide range of ability within the class.|Disruptive behaviour is more prominent in the lower ability range.

children.name: a test of ability/an ability test
examples: Examinations are not always a good test of ability.|The class was given a verbal ability test.

children.name: an ability group
children.definition: a group that students are taught in, based on their level of ability
examples: Children are divided into different ability groups.

children.name: facility
children.definition: a natural ability to do sth easily and wellSYN talent: khả năng

children.name: facility for
examples: She has an amazing facility for languages.
His facility for languages is astonishing.

children.name: talent
children.definition: anaturalability to do something very well which can be developed with practice: tài năng
examples: Hehasa lot oftalent, and his work is fresh and interesting.

children.name: have talent
examples: Greg has a real talent for drawing.

children.name: show talent
examples: Zach was the only one who showed any natural talent.

children.name: use your talents
examples: They have been using their artistic talents to brighten up the school.

children.name: develop your talent
examples: Education allows people to develop their talents to the full.

children.name: waste your talents
examples: They felt their son was wasting his talents and his time.

children.name: sb’s talents flourish
children.definition: develop successfully
examples: The school created an atmosphere in which young talent could flourish.

children.name: great/considerable/exceptional talent
examples: He had a great talent for making money.

children.name: real talent
examples: She has real talent and with a little help she could go far.

children.name: natural talent
examples: Ronaldo is a player of immense natural talent.

children.name: raw talent
children.definition: used to describe someone with natural ability who has not had much training
examples: He’s got lots of raw talent but he needs a good coach.

children.name: a hidden talent
examples: Have a go – you may discover a hidden talent!

children.name: musical/artistic/creative etc talent
examples: It was at school that Brian’s musical talents were spotted.

children.name: a talent contest/show/competition
examples: Don’t assume winning a talent contest is a passport to success.

children.name: a wealth of talent
children.definition: a large amount of talent
examples: There’s a wealth of musical talent in New York and other large American cities.

children.name: a pool of talent
children.definition: lots of talented people
examples: Employers can draw on an enormous pool of talent in this area.

children.name: talent for
examples: Sheshowedatalentfor acting at an early age.
Porter has a talent for making a difficult subject understandable and interesting.
Your brother isa man of many talents.
There’s awealth of talentin English football.

children.name: aptitude
children.definition: the natural ability, especially in learning a new subject or activity and become good at it: năng khiếu
examples: A trainee with normal aptitude can learn these techniques in a few months.

children.name: aptitude for
examples: At an early age Susan showed an aptitude for languages.
He has anatural aptitudefor teaching.

children.name: aptitude test
examples: All applicants are given aptitude tests before being invited for interview.

children.name: competence
children.definition: 1 the ability to do something wellOPP in: năng lực
examples: 2[C] (alsocompetency)formala skill needed to do a particular job: năng lực
Typing is considered by most employers to be a basic competence.

children.name: have competence
examples: Older people often feel that they don't have any competence with computers.

children.name: demonstrate/show competence
examples: Students have to demonstrate competence in maths and science.

children.name: acquire/achieve/gain/develop competence
examples: First you have to acquire competence in methods of research.

children.name: lack competence
examples: Some staff members lacked the competence to deal with technical problems.

children.name: professional competence
examples: The courses will improve the skills and professional competence of the staff.

children.name: technical/linguistic/managerial etc competence
examples: There are many careers that require a high degree of linguistic competence.

children.name: social competence
examples: The first years of life are very important in a child's growth toward social competence.

children.name: a level/standard/degree of competence
examples: The trainees are expected to acquire a basic level of competence.

children.name: competence in
examples: Students will gain competence in a wide range of skills.

children.name: competence of
examples: He questioned the competence of the government.

children.name: professional/linguistic/technical etc competence
examples: Doctors have to constantly update their knowledge in order to maintain their professional competence.

children.name: flair
children.definition: a natural ability to do sth very well, especially sth that needs imagination and creativity: tài, năng khiếu

children.name: have a flair for
examples: If you have a flair for languages, there are some good career opportunities in Europe.
Irwin has real entrepreneurial flair.

children.name: having a natural ability to do sth well
talented
children.definition: very good at doing something because you have a lot of natural ability:
examples: tài năng
▪ The show has talented actors, but the writing is poor.
Chương trình có những diễn viên tài năng, những kịch bản thì tệ.
highly talentedvery talented
rất tài năng
▪ The Brazilian team includes some highly talented young players
Đội tuyển Brazil có những cầu thủ trẻ rất tài năng.
.▪ The musicians are talented and enthusiastic about their new venture.
Những nhạc sĩ rất tài năng và hăng hái về dự án mạo hiểm mới.
talentedadjective có tài; có khiếu
with talent; able or skilful
_a talented footballer/pianist

children.name: gifted
children.definition: very good at doing something, especially art, music, or sport, because you were born with natural ability:
examples: có năng khiếu bẩm sinh
▪ Picasso was one of the most gifted artists who ever lived.
Picasso là một trong những nghệ sĩ tài năng nhất trên đời.
▪ It’s a difficult subject, even for a writer as gifted as Mathers.
Đó là một chủ đề khó, kể cả với một nhà văn tài nằng như Mathers.
gifted children
trẻ có khiếu
▪ Most school systems offer programs for gifted children.
Nhiều trường cung cấp những chương trình học cho trẻ có năng khiếu.
highly giftedvery gifted
rất tài năng
▪ He is a highly gifted young singer, who combines a beautiful voice with unusual musical sensitivity.
Anh ta là một ca sĩ trẻ rất tài năng, kết hợp giọng hát dẹp với lối cảm thụ âm nhạc mới lạ.
giftedadjective
having special ability in a particular subject or activity
_a gifted dancer/musician

children.name: a natural
children.definition: someone who has a natural ability to do something and thinks it is easy as soon as they start to do it:
examples: bẩm sinh
▪ His sense of humor made him a natural for the TV talk shows.
Anh ta có khiếu bẩm sinh trong các chương trình giao lưu trên truyền hình nhờ khiếu hài hước.
a natural at
có khiếu về
▪ McAvoy is a natural at public relations.
McAvoy có khiếu trong quan hệ công chúng.
natural/ natural-born[adjective only before noun]
bẩm sinh
▪ She is a natural leader.
Bà ấy là một nhà lãnh đạo bẩm sinh.
▪ a natural-born story teller
người kể chuyện bẩm sinh

children.name: have an aptitude for
children.definition: to have a natural ability to learn a particular subject or skill very easily and quickly:

children.name: có năng khiếu trong
examples: ▪ The school is for children who have an exceptional aptitude for math and science.
Ngôi trường dành cho những học sinh có năng khiếu toán học và khoa học.

children.name: have a gift for
children.definition: have a gift for languages/ painting/ music/ dancing etc have a special natural ability to do something very well, especially something artistic:

children.name: có năng khiếu
examples: ▪ Mozart had a gift for music even when he was very young.
Mozart có năng khiếu âm nhạcthậm chí từ khi còn rất nhỏ.
▪ As a director, he has a gift for inspiring his actors to give their best performances.
Là một đạo diễn, anh ta có khiếu trong việc truyền cảm hứng để diễn viên hoàn thành xuất sắc nhất.

children.name: bẩm sinh
examples: born leader/ teacher/ writer etcsomeone who clearly has a natural ability to lead, teach etc well, so that it seems as if they do not need to be taught how to do it:

children.name: lãnh đạo/ nhà giáo/ nhà văn bẩm sinh
examples: ▪ When I read his first essays I knew that he was a born writer.
Khi tôi đọc đoạn văn đầu tiên tôi biết ngay anh ấy là nhà văn bẩm sinh.
▪ He seemed to be a born leader, someone who inspired confidence and loyalty.
Anh ta có vẻ là nhà lãnh đạo bẩm sinh, một người truyền cảm hứng về sự tự tin và lòng trung thành.

children.name: the ability that only few people have
genius
children.definition: a very great ability, which only a few people have: thiên tài, tài thiên bẩm
examples: The film reveals Fellini’s genius.

children.name: work/writer/man etc of genius
examples: Wynford was an architect of genius.
Picasso was a painterof genius.

children.name: a stroke of genius(= a very clever idea)
examples: At the time, his appointment seemed a stroke of genius.

children.name: a work ofpure genius
examples: Could a computer ever achieve the genius of men like Newton and Einstein.
Maurice was always entertaining, but there was a touch of genius in the way he talked that night.

children.name: have a genius for (doing) sth
examples: Sandra will deal with it. That woman has a genius for organization.
That womanhas a genius fororganization.
